headline: Beef Stroganoff for Instant Pot
description: This Instant Pot beef stroganoff gives you big, slow-cooked flavor in a fraction of the usual time. Cooking egg noodles right in the gravy is brilliant.

video.description: Fill up the family with a totally tasty one-pot meal!
video.name: Beef Stroganoff for Instant Pot¬Æ

name: Beef Stroganoff for Instant Pot
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes
0.75 cup sour cream, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot) and select Saut√© function. Heat oil for 1 minute.
Add onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt to pot; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, 3 to 4 minutes.
Sprinkle beef with 1 teaspoon salt and the pepper. Add to the pot. Cook and stir until beef is evenly browned, about 2 minutes.
Add garlic and thyme; cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour in soy sauce. Stir mushrooms into the pot. Stir in flour until incorporated. Stir in chicken broth and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Close and lock the lid. Set to high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method.
Open pot; stir in egg noodles. Close and lock the lid. Set to high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions for 5 minutes.
Release pressure naturally for 5 minutes according to manufacturer's instruction. Release remaining pressure using the quick-release method.
Open pressure cooker; stir in sour cream.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is good. I followed the recipe fairly close except that I made it gluten free by using potato flakes instead of flour (works great) to thicken the sauce and put in garlic powder instead of fresh. I didn't like the idea of using chicken broth in a beef recipe, however I decided to try it and what do you know, the broth was quite delicious. I only had two cups of fresh mushrooms and it wasn't enough. It definitely needed more mushrooms. I didn't cook the noodles in the Instant Pot, so I had a lot of gravy. Some would say too much. I liked it more soupy, but you could leave out one of the cups of broth.

I made this with less noodles and more meat, steak ends. My husband loved it!!! He ate 3 large bowls of it! I add some corn starch to thicken the juices. I liked it but next time would put in more mushrooms. Will definitely make again.
Being a diabetic and on dialysis, I had to change a few spices, leaving out the sodium and using other spices, but it turned out well.
Way too much broth. This makes meat soup. Flavors are good but need half the broth and use beef broth, not chicken. Also add Worcestershire sauce.

Thank you, it's Delicious-a family crowd pleaser. I substituted Worchestershire Sauce for soy, truffle olive oil for canola (it smells nice when cooking), and used light sour cream. I finished it with an extra half tablespoon of flour to get the sauce where I like it.
Followed the directions exactly and it was very good. Next time I won‚Äôt add any additional salt but I‚Äôll definitely make it again.
I really liked it without mushrooms (allergy). I would recommend adding 1/2 cup more fluid with noodles if level is low

I followed the recipe exactly except I did 15 minutes on high pressure for the meat because I've found that a little more time with meat in the instantpot is usually needed to make it tender. It was very satisfiying. I will make it again.

Used Better than Bouillion Beef and 1/3 more the amount of liquid and noodles (Family of five) Currently waiting on NR but it smells wonderful. Probably should have added a bit more liquid but it looks great.

I‚Äôve never made beef stroganoff before but I‚Äôve had some made by others. I followed the recipe exactly and thought it tasted good. Even my girlfriend, who doesn‚Äôt usually like mushrooms (‚ÄúEw, fungus!‚Äù üòÇ) liked it!
Loved this recipe. I did W sauce instead of soy sauce cause I never heard of soy sauce in beef stroganoff. But, it turned out perfect and will definitely make again.

Delicious. I simplified the steps some. Once the onions are sauteed dump all the ingredients save the egg noodles into the pot at once. It turns out basically the same weather you sear the beef first or at the salt in stages vs dumping it all in at once.

Tried this for the first time in my InstaPot Duo 8, making dinner for 8 (did the 2 pounds of stewing beef option). Definitely modified it - must add 2 tablespoons of worcester sauce on top of the soy, as others have done. Used almost 4 cups of beef broth - don‚Äôt use chicken. Also used corn starch instead of flower. My only complaint is the salt was way too salty for me and my family - will likely cut back from the recipe‚Äôs suggested 2 teaspoons to only 1 teaspoon - maybe 1.5 at most. Finally, I used an entire 1 cup container of light sour creme. Otherwise, it was a fantastic recipe and the family loved it. Stew beef came out melt in your mouth tender, which is exactly how I like it.
The recipe was great. I used 2.5 lbs of beef. 3 tbsp of flour and a bit more sour cream.

This turned out absolutely perfect!! I followed the recipe exactly except when I added the noodles, I had to pour in a bit more chicken broth so that the noodles were submerged. Other than that I wouldn‚Äôt change anything because it turned out perfect!! The meat was so tender and the flavor is amazing! It‚Äôs such an easy recipe to follow and I will definitely be making this again! Thanks for sharing this!

I have never had success with a pressure cooker/instant pot recipe when I floured the beef prior to browning. The flour causes burning at the bottom of the pot and the unit will overheat, shut off and then there's a burnt mess. Most pressure cooker recipes recommend adding flour/thickener at the end of the recipe
I used beef riblets, they needed 5 additional minutes to be fall off the bone delicious. Stuck to the recipe and it came out really good.
Added Stroganoff seasoning
not worth the time and effort..just watery meat..and, yes, I CAN cook!

Definitely needs some changes, as others have described, but this is a great starting point. A box (4 cups) beef stock instead of 3 cups chicken stock, Worcestershire sauce instead of soy, I used a half tbsp thyme instead of 1/2 tsp, and it will need a slurry of 2 tbsp corn starch mixed into 1/2 cup of the warm cooking liquid and brought to a boil to thicken the sauce.
Turned out great. Besides the Worcestershire and beef broth I added a splash of red wine.
Made it by the recipe. Turned out just fine. I may try with beef broth next time like everyone is suggesting.
be sure to turn off the saut√© mode before starting the pressure cooking mode.
I added peas - soo yummy! Definitely would recommend this recipe !

I have read previous reviews and was quite surprised by many of them. Most were critical which sauce to use. 
I did not vary from the recipe at all. It was 
Perfect. I have prepared beef stroganoff many times in the past and found this interpretation to be quite exceptional.
I felt like it needed more flavors, but the recipe cooked everything perfect.

I agree with many other reviewers here. This is a good base recipe, but absolutely phenomenal with adjustments. I saut√©ed the onion and garlic first and removed to a bowl. I browned the meat (beef shoulder) in two batches. I seasoned the meat with Badia Complete Seasoning. I added the mushrooms and thyme and onions and garlic and cooked for a couple more minutes. Added 4 cups of beef broth and pressure cooked for 18 minutes with a quick release. Added most, but not all, of the 16 oz package of noodles, and stirred them in so they were covered. Pressure cooked for 7 minutes more, with a 4 minute natural release. Added sour cream and cream cheese and a slurry of 2 TB of corn starch and beef broth and I let it saut√© for another 5 minutes. This was the best beef stroganoff we've ever eaten!
So far so good!! I made it per instructions first except omitting the mushrooms because my husband does not like them. But I did make a side dish of saut√©ed asparagus, mushrooms and onions
Just be sure to use low salt or unsalted broth! Other than that, it was very yummy.
Great recipe, I added a few extra cloves because you can never have to much garlic!
The flavor was fairly yummy however not all egg noodles cooked had some crunchy pieces. And I used 4 cups broth and it still ended up on the dry side.
Loved this recipe, but used beef broth instead of chicken for a beefier flavor.

Great recipe! I took the advice from a few other reviews and used beef broth instead of chicken broth. I also used Worcestershire sauce instead of soy sauce. I used 5 cloves of garlic instead of three. I added 4 ounces of cream cheese at the end. This stroganoff was easy to make and the whole family loved it.
We thought this was very good and didn‚Äôt make any changes
Very delicious recipe!
We have tried several instant pot recipes for beef stroganoff this is by far the best so good.

I enjoyed this recipe. I did not make any changes, except that I only used 1.5 lbs of meat instead of 2 lbs. The beef was tender. There could have been a bit more sauce at the end for my tastes, but otherwise it was very good.
I thought this recipe was really tasty using the substititions recommended for the beef broth and Worchestershire sauce. Also used 3 teaspoons of chopped garlic in oil and it was delish!
Fantastic. Super easy to make in a really flavorful rich meal in one pot!!
Hands down the BEST instant pot version of beef stroganoff. Make it exactly as written and works great being doubled (which I suggest for leftovers). A family favorite!]
It was great! one of my first Instant pot dinner tries
My wife and I made this today and loved it. We used 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth with 1 1/2 cups of water instead of 3 cups broth.
I didn't measure exactly. I may have used slightly more sour cream. It turned out delicious!! Lots of leftovers.

5 stars. I changed up a few things. I use cajun seasoning instead of salt and pepper (suck as Tony Chacherie). I used steak seasoning to beef. I love garlic, I used 6 cloves finely chopped. A little soy, AND a goodly amount of Worcestershire. At the end 1/4 block of cream cheese as well as sour cream. PERFECTION!

I rarely make recipes as directed, I'm usually tweaking them as I go...BUT this recipe was spot on! The whole family loved it just as it was. I did make a double batch for our hungry fam of four and was able to have a little bit leftover for a quick lunch or two through the week.
Easy and tasty!
So yummy
I made it exactly as written...it turned out perfect! Thank you for this recipe! My family loved it!
Seared meat prior to sauteing onions.

Recipe was excellent and a snap to make. I would add four cups of mushrooms and four cups of chicken stock so there is more sauce/gravy. I would also bump the flour to 2.5 tbl. I used a 2.8 lb chuck roast. and 13 minutes of high pressure

Definitely a keeper!! Word of warning on opening the valve on my Instant Pot Duo. Both steam and the sauce came out. Best to do a "controlled release". Takes a minute longer, but you will avoid the mess. Enjoy.

First of all, I've made it three times and the overall recipe is fantastic. If you only make it by the recipe, it works.

I do agree with others that using beef broth makes a lot more sense. But I went further. I replaced one cup of the broth with a dry red wine. This made the finished product taste PRECISELY like the old Russian recipe I had always used.

The finished product also benefits from a rest after completion. Use your Instant Pot's "keep warm" function, put the lid back on after mixing in the sour cream and let it rest while you fix a salad and pour the wine.

Very yummy and easy. Made a few adjustments:
Used 1 can of low sodium chicken broth and half a can of beef broth.
Added partially cooked gluten free noddles and did end up needing a little additional broth. Otherwise, perfect.
I expected to like this more than I did. I found it somewhat bland. Also, there was not enough liquid to cook the noodles so I had to add more broth and more cook time.

Made this almost exactly as written. I used reduced salt soy sauce and chicken stock (similar to Better than Bouillon) instead of chicken broth because that‚Äôs what we have on hand. This has become a family favorite. Considering trying the Worcestershire sauce and beef bouillon next time to see if it‚Äôs even better...
I added shallots, doubled the garlic and used pork broth instead of chicken.
REALLY good recipie! Super yummy and easy to make. I make it for myself and my son on a regular basis now and its always a hearty hit!
Turned out perfect for my first instant pot recipe!
Soooooo good! Will make again and again....

Decent with changes. First thing is the soy sauce. The flavors clashed so it had to go. I added extra mushrooms and a splash of red wine and that fixed most of it. Also extra garlic, and sprinkle chopped dill on top.
Like others, I used Worcestershire sauce instead of soy and added a flour slurry after pressure cooking to thicken the sauce. I also had to cook the noodles about 5 minutes longer. Delicious!

I give this recipe five stars when you follow others suggestions of using Worcester Sauce instead of soy, beef broth instead of chicken and omit the salt completely. I did this and it came out awesome!

This was easy and delicious. It made enough for 3 + dinners for my husband and myself. I used beef broth instead of chicken broth and Worcestershire sauce instead of soy as other reviews suggest. I was surprised that the noodles came out as good as if I boiled them separately!
I followe reader's suggestions and used beef broth, Worcestershire and did not add flour. I used condensed broth, but cut down on the added water. My husband loved it!

This recipe was very bland. I recommend adding a lot more of the spices, especially pepper. 
Also, this is not meant for the instant pot mini. I didn‚Äôt think ahead and had to transfer everything to a pot on the stove for the last step.

This was delicious. However, I did make a small adjustment. I had leftover beef strips that I thawed out. I followed the recipe except for browning the beef. I also added one can of cream of mushroom soup. My husband loved it.
Loved it only thing I did different was about 2 cups sour cream
Made it to exact recipe. It's good but next time using others ideas about beef broth and subbing out soy sauce. Maybe then more a beefy flavor.

Like the others, use beef or vegetable broth instead of chicken broth. Use Worcestershire sauce instead of soy sauce. Stir noodles in after adding. Another helpful hint. If using frozen egg noodles do not use the suggested time, add 8-10 minutes so the noodles aren‚Äôt tough.

This has become a favorite for our family. I change a few things, though. I substitute worcestershire sauce for soy. And I pressure cook the chuck in everything but the Noddles, mushrooms and sour cream for 45 min, which makes it super tender. Then I do add the noodles and mushrooms for the 10 min cycle, and when that's done finish with the sour cream.
It‚Äôs definitely better with Worcestershire Sauce & Beef Broth. It‚Äôs really a great meal.

I flowed the recipe exactly in my Instant Pot. The flavor is very good but, not all the noodles cooked through. The ones towards the top were undercooked. I will add more broth than called for next time. Overall, it‚Äôs a good and relatively easy recipe that may need tweaking to adjust for perfection. I think I‚Äôll also try beef stock next time.
Turned out great! Could have cooked the meat longer and have it fall apart more but it was good overall.
I would and will make this again. I'll use more mushrooms next time. This was yummy.
I wasn't able to mix the noodles in well enough so some were underdone and some overdone. Next time I may just make them separately on the stove and add to the Stroganoff at the end.
Same story as many others. Substitute Chicken Broth for beef, Soy sauce for Worcestershire, 12oz instead of 16oz noodles, left the flour until the end.

This was delicious. Just plan on trying to eat it all that night because it didn't reheat well the next day at work. The noodles were mushy. Otherwise, I will be making this again but only when there are 4 or more of us.

Great recipe start but made several of the noted subs. Used beef broth, 1/2c sour cream and 1/2c cream cheese, 12 oz egg noodles, and thickened with corn starch on saut√© mode after the pressure cooking was finished. Used the soy sauce but if I had it I‚Äôd use Worcestershire sauce. I also marinated cut beef (roughly 1/2‚Äùx1/2‚Äùx2‚Äù) in red wine and added that to the pot. Timing was spot on for both the beef and the noodles. Turned out delicious! Thanks for posting!!

I changed this up but that's why I love using the instant pot, I used beef broth only because it makes more sense. I added more mushrooms because I enjoy them, used corn starch held out 1/4 cup of the broth added the corn starch to that 1/4 cup, added that when I added the noodles I will make this again but I will add a little more flavorings.
Added a little more broth and used Alfredo sauce instead of the cream in the recipe
This was so good. Made it exactly as written and it turned out absolutely fabulous. I will definitely be making this one again. So easy . It is all made in the instant pot. so clean up was easy too.

Because of food allergies, I could not use Worcestershire Sauce. I doubled the spices. The first half I mixed with the meat then allowed it to marinade for 2-hours. I used the balance according to the recipe.

As for adding the thickener, I added 3/4 cup of broth when I added the noodles. It turned out great.

This was so incredibly easy to make and it tasted amazing. I added a little more stock to it cause we like the juice. And when I reheated the left overs for lunch I just added more chicken stock and it tasted new all over again. Definitely try it. We‚Äôve made this a keeper.
Added more garlic, Worchestshire, and chives. Family loved it!

Delicious! I reduced the servings to 4 and think I didn‚Äôt have enough liquid. After adding the noodles and running the 5 minute pressure cook and 5 minute rest, the noodles were hard. I added more broth, gave it a stir and repeated the pressure cook time. Came out perfect!

It turned out very good except the meat could have been a little more tender. I should have probably cut the meat a little smaller or cooked it a little longer in the beginning. I will definitely try it again.
My hubby loved it. Fresh, not too heavy with tender meat. Leftovers were wonderful too. I think it is a assured have again meal.

Excellent?? Learning the Instant Pot. Directions worked well. We used sirloin tip steak, grilled esrlier. Decreased the cooking time for the meat. Grilled sirloin added flavor. Wide egg noodles worked great. No worries if the very upper noodles look dry, they will turn right in as stroganoff is mixed at the end.
Great recipe. I used worst over soy and beef broth over chicken broth. Excellent.
Delicious! Only thing I changed was the broth. Like everyone else I used beef broth and I also used 4 1/2 cups bc we like extra sauce. I used a little more flour also.
Turned out ok, but nothing special. On the plus side, it was very easy to make.
Easy to make and very tasty.
First time I made it. It was good and very filling. My husbandiled it and it was easy to make. Will add to my repertoire.
I make this again and again.
Delicious and easy to prepare. I used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. I'll make this again.
Another delicious recipe from All Recipe!

I used this recipe for my maiden voyage of using my instant pot, which I received as a wedding present nearly 2 years ago. I chose well, based on the results.? I basically followed the exact recipe with the exception of substituting Worcestershire sauce for soy sauce, as so many reviewers recommended, and I did add approximately 2 cups of frozen peas when I added the noodles. This added color and nutrition.
Made this tonight and it was yummy. Added the Worcestershire like others recommended. Added a few dashes of Franks hot sauce at the end for extra flavor and a little spice. My boyfriend loved it.

The food turned out great but the recipe is poorly written:
1. I didn't use chicken broth OR soy sauce--I used beef broth and Worcestershire sauce. I also used whole wheat noodles.

2. Natural release is needed after the meat cooks, not quick release. If you want to spend time cleaning up a huge mess, then do the quick release. The sauce spewed out the top of my IP and made a huge, greasy mess.

3. Flour as a thickener needs to be added AFTER the meat cooks. I had to thin out the mixture because I got a burn notice so either increase the amount of liquid when adding the flour OR add a flour slurry after the meat cooks.

Otherwise this was pretty good.

I dredged the stew meat int seasoned flour, used the saut√© setting and browned it in the instant pot, then added minced dried onion and beef broth and some Kitchen Bouquet. ThenI I cooked it at full pressure for 15 minutes, let the pressure release before continuing with the recipe. It was very good.
